info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued January 07 at 2:37AM PST until January 10 at 7:00PM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM PST THIS MORNING ABOVE 2000 FEET... ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY EVENING... * WHAT... - For the Winter Weather Advisory above 2000 feet, additional snow accumulations of up to 3 inches. - For the Winter Storm Watch above 3000 feet, large snow accumulations possible of 7 to 19 inches, with higher amounts up to 36 inches possible in the higher terrain of eastern Douglas County. Winds could gust as high as 60 mph could cause frequent whiteout conditions. * WHERE... - For the Advisory, elevations above 2000 feet in eastern Curry, Josephine, eastern Douglas and Jackson Counties including the cities of Toketee Falls, Butte Falls, and Ashland. Impacted roadways include the lower I-5 passes of Sexton Summit and Canyon Mountain and portions of highways 140, 62, 138, and 238. - For the Watch, elevations above 3000 feet in Jackson County, including Tiller Highway (227), highway 62 above Shady Cove, and highway 140; Also Douglas County, including highway 138 above Toketee Falls and highway 230. * WHEN... - For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 10 AM PST this morning. - For the Winter Storm Watch, from late Monday night through Wednesday evening. * IMPACTS... - For the advisory, plan on slippery road conditions and low visibilities due to snow and blowing snow. - For the Watch, travel could be very difficult to impossible. Widespread blowing snow could significantly in whiteout conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Strong winds could cause tree damage, especially with trees becoming heavily loaded with snow. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...1"/hour snowfall rates are currently forecast above 4000 feet most of Tuesday from 10 AM through Wednesday morning. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. * Carry tire chains and be prepared for snow covered roads and limited visibilities. * See https://www.tripcheck.com for latest road conditions. * A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means that periods of snow will cause travel difficulties. A Winter Storm Watch means that severe winter weather is impending and poses a threat to life and property. Take protective action now.
